content: Recent-ish removal generic_const_exprs default feature in https://github.com/rust-lang/portable-simd/pull/248 appears to have nuked Simd::to_ne_bytes and Simd::from_ne_bytes from docs. (A changelog for major breaking changes like these would also be appreciated)
Are you using the crate directly from GitHub rather than std::simd on nightly? That feature never actually made it to nightly.

Alas.
We mostly organize the crate around its structure for inclusion in std nowadays, yes.
Yeah. So while it's possible to use the crate itself, that's really for testing purposes and I'd recommend using the nightly module.
we probably do need a changelog, since there are also other breaking changes such as renaming horizontal->reduce, and lanes->elementwise and similar.

Yeah, I did cargo update on a bleeding edge testing project that hasn't been touched in a while.

forbid(unsafe_code) was one of the goals so I've stuck with the crate for its convenient transmutes.
